image.alt: Smiling teen with braces at Backus Smiles

paragraphs.text: At Backus Smiles, led by Dr. Dominique Backus, we provide comprehensive orthodontic care for patients of all ages. Our mission goes beyond creating beautiful smiles — we develop healthy, functional smiles tailored to each patient’s needs.
We treat patients like family in a warm, welcoming environment and combine personalized care with modern technology and comfort-focused touches, making treatment convenient and positive.

items.title: Complimentary Visit
items.text: Start with a no-cost initial exam to evaluate needs and outline a personalized treatment plan.

items.title: Patient-First Team
items.text: A warm, family atmosphere focused on comfortable, individualized care with friendly team touches.

items.title: Modern Options
items.text: Evidence-based treatments including clear aligners and self-ligating braces for efficient, comfortable care.

items.title: Easy Scheduling

image.alt: Front desk scheduling at Backus Smiles

items.text: Flexible appointment times, insurance guidance, and convenient online scheduling to fit your life.

paragraphs.text: Dr. Dominique Backus brings a patient-centered approach to every treatment. She focuses on respectful, individualized care and builds relationships with patients and families. Outside the office she enjoys reading, tennis, volunteering, and time with her husband and children.

image.alt: Dr. Dominique Backus, orthodontist at Backus Smiles

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christine Stang brings advanced training and a commitment to personalized, state-of-the-art orthodontic care. She values strong patient relationships and aims to deliver predictable, compassionate results for children and adults alike.
We offer a full range of orthodontic options, from clear aligners to advanced bracket systems and retainers to fit each patient’s goals and lifestyle.

og_meta.title: Home - Backus Smiles
og_meta.description: Backus Smiles provides friendly, modern orthodontic care including Invisalign®, Damon braces, Spark aligners, and retainers.

image.alt: Backus Smiles office front exterior with welcoming entrance

paragraphs.text: At Backus Smiles our mission is to provide superior orthodontic care in a friendly, efficient practice that treats every patient with respect and personalized attention.
We run an organized schedule so patients are seen promptly and offer flexible appointment times to fit busy lives, because great care should be convenient.
We offer comprehensive treatment options for children, teens, and adults, including braces and clear aligners, and we tailor each plan to meet patients’ goals and lifestyles.
Through modern technology, a compassionate team, and clear communication, we help patients feel comfortable, informed, and confident about their smile journey.

image.alt: Dr. Dominique Backus smiling, Backus Smiles

paragraphs.text: Dr. Dominique Backus is a caring orthodontist who builds personal relationships with patients and treats everyone with respect and courtesy. She brings decades of clinical experience to Backus Smiles and approaches each case with careful attention to comfort and long-term function.

Outside the office she enjoys time with her husband and three children, reading, tennis, volunteering, knitting, Cajun-inspired cooking, and hot yoga, and she remains active in community outreach and school programs.

image.alt: Dr. Backus with a patient contest winner

paragraphs.text: Dr. Backus completed her DDS and specialty training in orthodontics after earning a B.S. in Microbiology from Louisiana Tech University. Her training includes a Doctor of Dental Surgery (1997), Advanced Education in General Dentistry Certificate (1998), and a Specialty Certificate in Orthodontics with a Master of Science in 2000 from LSU School of Dentistry.

image.alt: Dr. Backus with a fellow clinician

paragraphs.text: Dr. Backus is deeply involved in Homewood and surrounding communities through school sponsorships, fundraisers, and long-standing support for organizations such as United Ability, The Service Guild, Civiettes Club, Baby Steps, The Bell Center, and local schools.

image.alt: Dr. Backus and team participating in community charity work

About.title: Meet Dr. Christine F. Stang, DDS, MSD

paragraphs.text: Dr. Christine Stang is a dedicated orthodontist known for state-of-the-art care and personalized treatment. She focuses on building positive relationships with patients and delivering predictable, efficient results.

Dr. Stang earned her undergraduate degree from James Madison University and completed her Doctor of Dental Surgery and Master of Science in Dentistry with specialized orthodontic training at the Medical College of Virginia, where she graduated summa cum laude.

Dr. Stang enjoys family life with her husband and two sons and is active in community volunteer work, including Reston Smile Partners. She values the relationships formed through orthodontic care and the confidence a healthy smile brings.

items.name: Martie Martindale
items.bio: Martie brings a fun-loving spirit and more than 40 years of orthodontic experience. She enjoys tennis, her grandkids, and supporting neighborhood restaurants.

items.name: Amanda Sims
items.bio: Amanda oversees daily operations, insurance, and patient financial needs. She has been with the practice since 2017 and enjoys travel and live music.

items.name: Emily Beatty
items.bio: Emily is often the first friendly face patients meet. A former elementary school teacher, she enjoys concerts, restaurants, and time with her husband and dog.

items.name: Aimie Marshall
items.bio: Aimie brings an outgoing personality and a multi-skilled background in marketing and scheduling. She enjoys camping, cooking, and sewing.

items.name: Madison Myrick
items.bio: Madison supports clinical care as an orthodontic assistant and helps create a calm, positive experience for patients.

items.name: Front Desk & Clinical Team
items.bio: Our front desk and clinical team members work together to keep appointments running smoothly and ensure every patient feels welcomed and cared for.

slides.alt: Coffee bar in the waiting area

paragraphs.text: Backus Smiles is committed to supporting local schools and nonprofits through sponsorships, fundraisers, and volunteer work. Dr. Backus and the team regularly partner with Homewood and Vestavia events, United Ability, Baby Steps, The Bell Center, and other community organizations to raise funds and provide support where it’s needed most.

og_meta.title: About Us | Backus Smiles
og_meta.description: Learn about Backus Smiles' mission, Dr. Dominique Backus and our team, community involvement, and how to schedule your first visit.

image.alt: Welcoming family at orthodontic office front desk

paragraphs.text: Your first visit is complimentary. During this initial exam we’ll meet with you, review your dental and medical history, and take the images needed for a clear diagnosis so Dr. Backus can recommend the most appropriate treatment.
We’ll walk through your treatment options, answer questions about braces or clear aligners, and review insurance and payment plans so you leave with a clear next step and no surprises.

image.alt: Parent and child checking in at a dental reception desk

paragraphs.text: We’ll help you review your benefits and check with your insurance company so you know what’s covered. If you have orthodontic coverage, it can reduce your out‑of‑pocket cost.
If you don’t have coverage, ask about our flexible payment plans. Our treatment coordinator will explain options and help find a plan that fits your budget.

Save time by completing your new‑patient paperwork before your visit. You can schedule appointments, review our complimentary first‑visit details, or complete a practice registration form online using the links below.

image.alt: Patient completing medical history form online

seo.page_description: Start your journey with Backus Braces. Schedule a complimentary first visit, review insurance and financing options, and complete new‑patient forms online.
seo.page_keywords: Backus Braces, complimentary first visit, new patient forms, orthodontics, insurance, financing, schedule appointment

og_meta.title: Get Started | Backus Braces
og_meta.description: Start your journey with Backus Braces. Schedule a complimentary first visit, review insurance and financing options, and complete new‑patient forms online.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Backus Braces

paragraphs.text: Damon System braces use a self-ligating bracket that lets teeth move more freely, often reducing appointments and improving comfort. Dr. Backus and our team select this option for patients who want efficient, reliable correction when traditional bracket-based treatment is the best clinical choice.

image.alt: Damon braces typodont showing clear brackets and archwire

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces are placed on the tongue side of the teeth, making them invisible from the front. They are fully customized to each smile and offer a discreet option for teens and adults who need the control of fixed braces without the visible hardware.

image.alt: Illustration comparing lingual (behind-the-teeth) braces to clear aligners

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners to move teeth gently and predictably. Each set of trays is planned with precise 3-D imaging so your treatment follows a mapped sequence of movements designed by Dr. Backus.
Because aligners are removable, you can eat and brush normally. They are made from a patented SmartTrack material and are often chosen for their comfort and nearly invisible appearance.

Spark aligners use TruGEN material for a clearer, more stain‑resistant tray that many patients find comfortable. They work similarly to other clear aligner systems and are a great option for mild to moderate crowding or spacing when a low‑profile solution is preferred.

Traditional metal braces remain a dependable solution for complex alignment and bite issues. Small brackets and wires are adjusted over time to guide teeth into the intended positions, and they are especially effective for more involved movements that removable options can't always address.

image.alt: Happy patient with traditional metal braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces offer the control of fixed orthodontics with brackets that blend into tooth color. They provide an attractive, lower‑profile alternative when brace‑based treatment is clinically appropriate.

image.alt: Smiling woman with clear ceramic braces

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers protect your results. We offer bonded and removable options, including Essix clear retainers and Hawley plates, and provide guidance to help you maintain your smile for the long term.
Other appliances such as palatal expanders and Motion appliances are used when needed to guide growth, create space, or correct specific bite problems as part of a coordinated treatment plan.

Temporomandibular joint (TMJ) problems can cause pain, limited opening, or jaw noise. Dr. Backus performs a thorough exam and recommends conservative measures first, such as splints, physical therapy, or targeted appliances, with surgical referral only when necessary.

paragraphs.text: Find clear, practical answers to common questions about orthodontics, treatment timing, and the benefits of early and adult care from the team at Backus Smiles.

Orthodontics is a dental specialty that focuses on aligning the teeth and jaws so they work in balance with the face. Using braces and other corrective appliances, orthodontists create a healthier bite and a more attractive smile.

An orthodontist is a dentist who has completed two to three years of additional training in an accredited graduate program. This extra education focuses on tooth movement, jaw growth, and how to achieve a stable, functional bite.

accordion.header: Can straight teeth improve health and confidence?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Properly aligned teeth are easier to clean and may lower the risk of cavities and gum disease. Correcting the bite can also improve chewing and speech, while helping many patients feel more confident about their appearance.

accordion.header: When should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends a first evaluation around age 7. Early checks let us monitor growth, guide eruption, and treat problems early when intervention can be simpler and more effective.

Two-phase treatment begins with early interceptive care to correct developing problems, followed by a second phase after most permanent teeth erupt to finish alignment. Early treatment can reduce the need for extractions or more complex procedures later.

seo.page_description: Find answers to common orthodontic questions about treatment timing, two-phase care, and the benefits of straight teeth at Backus Smiles.
seo.page_keywords: Backus Smiles, orthodontics, FAQ, braces, two-phase treatment, children
